skills.name: Find the absolute value of a number

explanations.A: Remember, the 'absolute value' of -7, means 'how far away from 0 is -7?'. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.
explanations.B: I think you might believe that negative numbers do not have an absolute value, but they do. The 'absolute value' of -7, means 'how far away from 0 is -7?'.
explanations.C: The 'absolute value' of -7, means 'how far away from 0 is -7?' so, the absolute value of -7 is 7.
explanations.D: I think you've counted the numbers from 0 to −7, including 0. Instead, you need to count the number of jumps (spaces) between 0 and -7.

explanations.A: I think you might believe that negative numbers do not have an absolute value, but they do. The 'absolute value' of -9, means 'how far away from 0 is -9?'.
explanations.B: The 'absolute value' of -9, means 'how far away from 0 is -9?' so, the absolute value of -9 is 9.
explanations.C: Remember, the 'absolute value' of -9, means 'how far away from 0 is -9?'. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.
explanations.D: I think you've counted the numbers from 0 to −9, including 0. Instead, you need to count the number of jumps (spaces) between 0 and -9.

explanations.A: I think you might believe that positive numbers do not have an absolute value, but they do. The 'absolute value' of 50, means 'how far away from 0 is 50?'.
explanations.B: I think you have confused 'absolute value' with 'opposite value'. Remember, the 'absolute value' of 50, means 'how far away from 0 is 50?'. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.
explanations.C: I think you have confused the absolute value of 50 with the multiplicative inverse of 50. Remember, the 'absolute value' of 50, means 'how far away from 0 is 50?'.
explanations.D: The 'absolute value' of 50, means 'how far away from 0 is 50?'. So, the absolute value of 50 is 50.

explanations.A: I think you have confused 'absolute value' with 'opposite value'. Remember, the 'absolute value' of 89, means 'how far away from 0 is 89?'. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.
explanations.B: I think you might believe that positive numbers do not have an absolute value, but they do. The 'absolute value' of 89, means 'how far away from 0 is 89?'.
explanations.C: The 'absolute value' of 89, means 'how far away from 0 is 89?'. So, the absolute value of 89 is 89.
explanations.D: I think you have confused the absolute value of 89 with the multiplicative inverse of 89. Remember, the 'absolute value' of 89, means 'how far away from 0 is 89?'.

explanations.A: Remember, |-12| means 'what is the absolute value of -12?'. The absolute value of a number is the distance from zero to the number. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.
explanations.B: I think you have accidentally included 0 when counting the distance from 0 to -12.
explanations.C: |-12| means 'what is the absolute value of -12?'. The absolute value of a number is the distance from zero to the number, so |-12| is 12.
explanations.D: I think you have got confused with absolute value and reversing the digits of a number. Remember, |-12| means 'what is the absolute value of -12?'. The absolute value of a number is the distance from zero to the number.

explanations.D: Remember, |-25| means 'what is the absolute value of -25?'. The absolute value of a number is the distance from zero to the number. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.

explanations.A: I think you have halved 200, but |200| means 'what is the absolute value of 200?'. Remember, the absolute value of a number means 'how far away from 0 is the number?'.
explanations.B: |200| means 'what is the absolute value of 200?'. The absolute value of a number is the distance from zero to the number, so |200| is 200.

explanations.D: I think you have confused 'absolute value' with 'opposite value'. Remember, |200|, means 'how far away from 0 is 200?'. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.

explanations.A: I think you have confused the absolute value of 550 with the multiplicative inverse of 550. Remember, |550|, means 'how far away from 0 is 550?'.
explanations.B: I think you have halved 550, but |550| means 'what is the absolute value of 550?'. Remember, the absolute value of a number means 'how far away from 0 is the number?'.
explanations.C: I think you have confused 'absolute value' with 'opposite value'. Remember, |550|, means 'how far away from 0 is 550?'. Absolute values are never negative as we are counting the distance from zero.
explanations.D: |550| means 'what is the absolute value of 550?'. The absolute value of a number is the distance from zero to the number, so |550| is 550.

explanations.A: It looks like you might think |12| = 0, but remember, the |12| means the absolute value of 12, so the distance from 0 to 12
explanations.B: Have another look at where the negative is. It is –|12|, not |–12|.
explanations.C: –|12| means -1 × |12|, so -1 multiplied by the absolute value of 12. The absolute value of 12 is the distance from 0 to 12, therefore |12| = 12, so –|12| = -1 × 12 = -12
explanations.D: I think you have got confused with absolute value and reversing the digits of a number. –|12| means -1 × |12|, so -1 multiplied by the distance from 0 to 12.

explanations.A: –|76| means -1 × |76|, so -1 multiplied by the absolute value of 76. The absolute value of 76 is the distance from 0 to 76, therefore |76| = 76, so –|76| = -1 × 76 = -76
explanations.B: I think you have confused the absolute value and reversing the digits of a number. –|76| means -1 × |76|, so -1 multiplied by the distance from 0 to 76.
explanations.C: It looks like you might think |76| = 0, but remember, the |76| means the absolute value of 76, so the distance from 0 to 76.
explanations.D: Have another look at where the negative is. It is –|76|, not |–76|.
